Class Numbers

java.lang.Object
Numbers
public class Numbers extends Object
CET - CS Academic Level 3 Declaration: I declare that this is my own original work and is free from Plagiarism This class represents a collection of numbers. It provides methods for adding values, finding minimum and maximum values, calculating average, and more. Student Name: Sina Khodaveisi Student Number: 041066567 Section #: 300 Course: CST8130 - Data Structures Professor: James Mwangi PhD.
Author:

  • Constructor Details

    • Numbers

      public Numbers()
      This is the default constructor for the Numbers class. It initializes an instance of Numbers with an empty array of Floats. The size of the array is set to -1 to indicate that it has infinite size.

    • Numbers

      public Numbers(int size)
      Constructor that initializes the numbers array.
      Parameters:
      size - - Max size of the numbers array

  • Method Details

    • addValue

      public void addValue(Scanner keyboard)
      Adds a value in the array
      Parameters:
      keyboard - - Scanner object to use for input

    • calcAverage

      public float calcAverage()
      Calculates the average of all the values in the numbers array. If the array is empty, it returns 0.
      Returns:
      the average value as a float

    • findMinMax

      public float[] findMinMax()
      This method finds the minimum value, maximum value, and modulo result in the array of numbers. If the array is empty, it returns an array with all values set to 0.
      Returns:
      an array of floats containing the minimum value, maximum value, and modulo result in that order

    • getfactorialMax

      public int getfactorialMax()
      Calculates the factorial of the maximum value in the numbers array. If the array is empty, it returns 0. If the maximum value is greater than or equal to 17, it returns Integer.MAX_VALUE
      Returns:
      the factorial of the maximum value as an integer

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Numbers object. The string includes each number in the array, separated by a newline character.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the Numbers object
